MRI LUMB OSACRAL SPINE
From:
DR Edmond How
Fax No:
2 8382 3799
Page:
1 of 2
Request No:
2500/00090
Service Date:
13/01/2025 at 14:44
CLINICAL HISTORY:
Past history of L4/5 fusion 2012. Well since surgery with right-sided pain.
TECHNIQUE:
1.5T high-resolution imaging.
COMPARISON:
Comparison is made with previous MRI lumbosacral spine study dated 17 June 2013.
FINDINGS:
The last completely unfused vertebral body has been designated L5 for counting purposes.
The conus medullaris terminates at the level of T12/L1 and this has a normal appearance. Post-surgical
changes with posterior interpedicular screw fixation at L4/5 with decompressive laminectomy and focal
distortion of the thecal sac. There is no recurrent disc extrusion. There is minimal grade 1 anterolisthesis of L4
on L5 but overall appearances have remained unchanged. There is disc desiccation at L4/5 but no significant
central or exit canal narrowing is identified. Facet joint hypertrophy is also noted at this level. The rest of the
levels are all intact. No prevertebral or paravertebral mass lesions.
Incidental finding of a suspected calcified uterine fibroid in the posterior uterine wall measuring 12 mm in size.
No prevertebral or paravertebral mass lesion.
IMPRESSION:
Since the last MRI examination of 17 June 2013, similar finding of post-surgical changes L4/5 without definite
features of exiting or descending nerve root impingement to account for the patient's symptoms.
Thank you for referring this patient.
Dr. Edmond How
Staff Specialist Radiologist
St Vincent's Hospital . NOTICE

DOUBLE BAY
DAY HOSPITAL
Level 2 Commercial
451 New South Head Road
Double Bay 2028
Patient Name: Ms Shelley Lucy Manea
Patient DOB : 09/03/1950
Indication
Positive Faecal Occult Blood Test under the National Bowel Cancer Screening Programme for
investigation.
Preparation
The bowel was prepared with Picosalax. The quality of the bowel preparation was good.
MBS Item No.
Positive FOBT - 32222 ; Polypectomy removal of 5 or more polyps - 32229
Extent of Exam
-
The instrument was inserted to the terminal ileum. Excellent views of the entire colon and terminal
ileum were obtained. The procedure was completed without difficulty.
Findings
Small external haemorrhoids were identified. These were small and were not bleeding.
DR Andrew FOWLER
MBBS (Hons), FRACP, MD
COLONOSCOPY REPORT
Date of procedure : 9 January 2025
Referring doctor: Dr Naomi Heath
Anaesthetist: Dr Timothy Nelly
Medication: Monitored Anaesthesia Care.
Several diverticula were identified in the sigmoid colon. These were small and large in size
and were not associated with muscular hypertrophy and luminal narrowing. There was no
evidence of mucosal inflammation to indicate acute diverticulitis.
Three polyps were identified in the right colon. The largest of these was approximately 3-6
mm in diameter and was sessile. Appearances were consistent with adenomatous
polyps. These were completely removed using a cold snareand were all retrieved and sent
for histology.
i
Specimens
i
Diagnosis
Two large peduculated polyps and one small sessile polyp were identified in the sigmoid
colon (approximately 15-20 mm in diameter). Appearances are consistent with
adenomatous polyps. They were excised using a hot snare polypectomy technique and
retrieved for histology. Prior to excision, the polyps were lifted using gelofusine, methylene
blue and 1:10,000 adrenaline.
Polyp(s): Three sigmoid colon polyps. Two ascending colon polyps. Caecal polyp x1 .
1. Six colonic polyps were excised.
2. Mild-moderate diverticular disease.
3. Small haemorrhoids.
Recommendation
Mrs Manea will require a repeat colonoscopy in 3-years. I have placed her in our database and will
send a reminder at the appropriate stage.
Await histological examination of the biopsy specimens taken.
Please arrange a follow-up review appointment with Dr George Marinos in 2-3 weeks (either a face-to-
face or video telehealth) so as to discuss the findings of this examination, the results of the biopsies
taken and treatment required, as well as to review the patient's clinical condition and to outline the
need for any future examination or other investigations.
Dr Andrew Fowler

Dr Trang Miller

Ophthalmic Surgeon
Provider No. 200009QB
Paediatric Ophthalmology
8 January 2025
Miss Frances Grasso
Shop 8
236 - 262 Quest Rd
HILLSDALE 2036
Dear Frances,
Re:
Miss Geneveve McDonald
36 Torrents Rd
MAROUBRA 2035
DOB: 9/07/2002
Our Ref: 400004
Diagnosis:
Normal structural eye exam. Normal physiological crowded optic discs.
Treatment:
Reassured.
Review:
With you yearly.
I saw Gene on the 24th October 2024. This letter is pertaining to that. Thank you for referring 16yo Gene, in
Year 10 at school, for my opinion of asymptomatic incidental finding of query physiologically small crowded
optic nerve heads as per your 14th Dec 2023 finding. From your document: BCVA (Optom): R+0.25/-0.50x 105
= 6/6 L+0.25/-0.50x75=6/6 Past Ophthalmic H: nil inj, nil sx, nil tx, nil drops. Family History: uncle ?possible
strab and ambylopia (paternal) Birth History: c-section, full term, nil complications, BW: 3.2kg . GH: good
Meds: Nil Allergies: lactose intolerance?, No known drug allergies. Social: 3 bros (youngest).
On examination: did not bring glasses: VAD sgls R6/7.5 PH 6/6-1 L6/7.5+2 PH NI (Vista) VAN sgls RN5 LN5
(DFV). Cover test: Distance sgls ortho CT. Near sgls sml XP c.gd re. LANG Il-sgls 4/4 (200") bunny=elephant,
fish=car We also took fundal photo and was normal. Optical coherence tomography nerve fibre layers around
optic discs were also normal: R 119 L 114 microns. Ganglion cell counts were also normal: R 88 and L 86
microns. Essentially emmetropic on cycloplegic retinoscopy. Indirect ophthalmoscopic exam: optic discs: Right
normal no swelling. Left normal. IOP R 19 L 17 (Icare). No relative afferent pupil defects. Normal red
saturation between eyes ..
Impression: Normal eye exam. Asymptomatic. Loves to read. No headaches. Wears glasses for reading and
screens from primary school (current ly old) - forgot to bring. Recommended back to you yearly. No
followup here. Happy to review of course if ever any new concerns in future. Thank you for the referral.
Yours sincerely,
Trang Miller MBBS(Qld) MMedStats FRANZCO (Electronically sighted and verified)
